page.title: 01BOW VILLAGE IN 1985
page.content: Bow bridge has been rebuilt to cope with floods and road widened to take the traffic passing through the main street.The village is gradually spreading itself in all directions,but mainly southwards,where new bungalows council and private are being built. The village shops are still being used but many people go to the towns for shopping.The raised cobbled bank running down one side of the village has become a conservation area and a pathway of nonslip bricks laid throughout its length.Listed buildings include the old School House,Winsor House and Top Chapel House.The Parish Council enter the best kept village competition each year.
